class_notes: This course covers the history, science, politics, and policy of nuclear weapons, the deadliest and most politically significant scientific breakthrough humanity has ever achieved. Topics covered include the scientific development of the first atomic bomb, the atomic bombing of Japan in World War II, Cold War nuclear crises including the Berlin and Cuban Missile Crises, causes and consequences of nuclear proliferation, public opinion and nuclear weapons, nuclear strategy, nuclear deterrence, Iran, North Korea, arms control, missile defense, nuclear accidents, nuclear terrorism, counterproliferation policy including economic sanctions, and others. There are no prerequisites for this course.
